feed.title: NewsTracker: baltimore
feed.subtitle: This is a news tracking demo

entry.title: Ex-Baltimore cop planning blackface fundraiser
entry.summary: -- A former Baltimore police officer said Wednesday that he plans to perform an Al Jolson routine in blackface to raise money for the six Baltimore officers who have been indicted in the death of Freddie Gray.

entry.title: In wake of riots and crime spike, Baltimore mayor under fire
entry.summary: In this photo taken Tuesday, July 21, 2015, Baltimore Mayor Stephanie Rawlings-Blake stands outside vacant homes before a ceremony to kick off their restoration in Baltimore.

entry.title: Mayor challenged by rioting, crime spike and firing of chief faces criticism, competition
entry.summary: For better or worse, since she sacked Police Commissioner Anthony Batts, the mayor has been alone at the top of a city government that has yet to show how it will repair the strained relationship between police and the people of inner-city Baltimore.

entry.title: In wake of riots and crime spike, Baltimore mayor under fire
entry.summary:
But for many in Baltimore, the memory of how Rawlings-Blake responded to the riots is too raw, and the city's unmet expectations are overwhelming.

"The people of Baltimore deserve better and we're going to get better," she said then.

The Baltimore Sun questioned Rawlings-Blake's leadership.

entry.title: Man charged with attempted murder after stabbing of Baltimore officer at student apartments
entry.summary: BALTIMORE - A 20-year-old man has been charged with attempted murder after Baltimore police say he stabbed an officer after a domestic dispute inside a student apartment building.

entry.title: Baltimore officers claim they gave statements under duress
entry.summary: BALTIMORE (AP) - Lawyers for three of the Baltimore police officers charged in the death of Freddie Gray have argued in court filings that their clients gave initial statements under duress because they were afraid of being fired.

entry.title: Army Corps of Engineers in Baltimore has new commander
entry.summary: The Baltimore District of the Army Corps of Engineers is welcoming a new commander.

entry.title: 'Wire' cast members to reunite for Baltimore performance
entry.summary: Cast members from HBO's "The Wire" are reuniting for a special performance to honor four of Baltimore's "unsung heroes."

entry.title: Baltimore County police kill unarmed man after suicide threat
entry.summary:
According to 2013 census figures, 27.5 percent of Baltimore County's population is black and 64.1 percent is white.

Also in the home at the time were two of his young daughters and their mother, Shannon Sulton, who told police McCain beat and threatened her, Baltimore County Police Chief Jim Johnson said at a news conference.

entry.title: Baltimore mayor fires police commissioner amid homicide rise
entry.summary: Interim Baltimore Police Department Commissioner Kevin Davis, left, listens to Mayor Stephanie Rawlings-Blake at a news conference, Wednesday, July 8, 2015, in Baltimore.

entry.title: Baltimore police chief fired amid crime spike, plummeting morale weeks after riots
entry.summary:
BALTIMORE - Less than three years ago, Anthony Batts was hand-picked by Baltimore Mayor Stephanie Rawlings-Blake to combat crime and reform a troubled law enforcement department in one of America's most violent cities.

Batts took over from Fred Bealefeld, who resigned after five years as commissioner and 31 in the Baltimore Police Department.

Batts too was a veteran officer, though new to the city of Baltimore: He spent three decades in California, two as commissioner of the embattled Oakland Police Department and seven as commissioner of the Long Beach police department, where he'd served as a law enforcement officer for 20 years.

"I worked closely with Commissioner Batts and always found him open to my ideas for reforming the department," said Baltimore City Council President Bernard C. "Jack" Young.

entry.title: Baltimore Mayor Fires Police Commissioner Amid Homicide Rise
entry.summary: Baltimore's mayor fired the troubled city's police commissioner Wednesday, saying that a recent spike in homicides in the weeks after an unarmed black man died of injuries in police custody required a change in leadership.

entry.title: Baltimore police commissioner fired after riot, killings
entry.summary: BALTIMORE Baltimore Police Commissioner Anthony Batts was fired on Wednesday following criticism of his handling of rioting over the death of a black man from an injury in police custody and a skyrocketing homicide rate.

entry.title: Baltimore police commissioner fired after riot, killings
entry.summary:
Batts, who came to Baltimore from California in September 2012 with a reputation as a reformer, will be replaced on an interim basis by Deputy Commissioner Kevin Davis.

Baltimore has tallied 155 killings for the year versus 105 in the same period in 2014, police said on Wednesday.

entry.title: Gunmen kill three, wound one near University of Maryland, Baltimore
entry.summary: Three people were killed and one was wounded when gunmen opened fire on a group of people on a street near the University of Maryland, Baltimore, police said on Wednesday.

entry.title: Baltimore County police kill unarmed man after suicide threat
entry.summary: Since January 2012, police responded to 17 domestic violence calls at the home in a quiet suburban community outside Baltimore, said Cpl.

entry.title: Recap: Boston vs. Baltimore
entry.summary:
Baltimore has taken nine of its last 12 series in Boston dating back to 2011, losing a series only once in that span.

It was 7-4 for Baltimore on a Machado two-out single to plate Pearce in the sixth, then the O's edge stretched to four in the seventh as Reimold hit a leadoff double and scored on a Davis double.

entry.title: Baltimore police probe transport van sign
entry.summary: Baltimore police probe transport van sign Police in Baltimore are investigating a sign posted inside a police transport van that tells passengers: "Enjoy your ride, cuz we sure will!"

entry.title: Baltimore police partially identify officers who killed unarmed man
entry.summary: Officers shot 41-year-old Spencer McCain Thursday in Owings Mills, about 15 miles northwest of Baltimore.

entry.title: Baltimore police open probe into new shooting of unarmed black man
entry.summary: Baltimore County Police Department salary records show Shenell Wilkes, Jonathan Besaw and Shannon Stargel as the only employees with those last names.

entry.title: DOJ asks Baltimore residents about police conduct
entry.summary:
BALTIMORE (AP) - The U.S. Justice Department on Thursday night held its first public forum since it began an investigation into whether the Baltimore Police Department has habitually violated the civil rights of Baltimore's citizens.

Residents who attended the forum at the University of Baltimore Law School broke up into small groups to speak one-on-one with agency attorneys about their experiences with the police.

entry.title: Baltimore police fatally shoot unarmed black man
entry.summary: -- An unarmed black man was fatally shot Thursday by officers in suburban Baltimore who thought he had a weapon when they were called to a home from which he was barred by protective order, the police chief said.
